title: How to Add Text to a Photo on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Photos.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Photos. The Photos icon resembles a colored pinwheel in a white box. It will be on your Home screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the photo you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the photo you want to edit. You can open a photo from your Albums, Moments, Memories, or iCloud Photo Sharing. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Edit button.
steps.content: Tap the Edit button. This button looks like three sliders on the toolbar at the bottom of your screen. [3] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021

steps.title: Tap the More button.
steps.content: Tap the More button. This button looks like three dots inside a circle in the bottom right of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Markup.
steps.content: Tap Markup . This is the toolbox icon on the pop-up menu. This will open your photo in the Markup editor. [4] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021 If you don't see Markup, tap More , and slide the Markup switch to On position. The switch should be green.

steps.title: Tap the Text button.
steps.content: Tap the Text button. This is the T icon in a box on the toolbar at the bottom of your screen. This button will add a textbox to your photo with some dummy text in it. [5] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 24 March 2021

steps.title: Double tap on the text.
steps.content: Double tap on the text. This will let you edit and replace the dummy text in the textbox.

steps.title: Type your text using your keyboard.
steps.content: Type your text using your keyboard.

steps.title: Tap the Done button above your keyboard.
steps.content: Tap the Done button above your keyboard. This is a different button from the Done button in the top-right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Select a color for your text.
steps.content: Select a color for your text. Tapping on a color from the color palette at the bottom of your screen will change the color of your text. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the AA next to the color palette.
steps.content: Tap the AA next to the color palette. This button will let you edit your font, text size, and alignment.

steps.title: Select a font.
steps.content: Select a font. You can select between Helvetica, Georgia, and Noteworthy.

steps.title: Change the size of your text.
steps.content: Change the size of your text. Slide the text size slider to the right for bigger text, and slide it to the left for small.

steps.title: Select an alignment for your text.
steps.content: Select an alignment for your text. Tap on an alignment button at the bottom of the pop-up menu. You can align left, center, justified, or right.

steps.title: Tap the AA button again.
steps.content: Tap the AA button again. This will close the pop-up.

steps.title: Tap and drag the text.
steps.content: Tap and drag the text. You can move it around the image. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done in the top-right corner of your screen.
steps.content: Tap Done in the top-right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Done again in the bottom-right corner of your screen.
steps.content: Tap Done again in the bottom-right corner of your screen. This will save your text to your photo.
